newsitem.title: THAILAND: Unocal to double Pailin natgas by 2001.
newsitem.headline: Unocal to double Pailin natgas by 2001.

text.p: Unocal Thailand, a unit of Unocal Corp, said on Tuesday it planned to double production of natural gas from Thailand's Pailin field to 330 million cubic feet a day (mmcfd) by 2001.
The company also said it had completed its natural gas appraisal wells drilling and had encountered gas-bearing sands in the first eight of a planned 16-well drilling program.
"The wells are part of drilling program to confirm gas reserves required to move ahead with phase II of Pailin development program," a company official told Reuters.
Pailin was discovered in 1990 and drilling to delineate the field began in 1993.
Natural gas production of the phase I is expected to come onstream in the last quarter of 1998 to produce 165 mmcfd.
Unocal is the operator and holds a 35 percent stake in the B12/27 block, where Pailin is located.

The other concessionaires are PTT Exploration & Production Plc which holds 45 percent stake, Amarada Hess and MOECO Thai Oil Development Co. The consortium signed a 30-year natural gas sales agreement with the state-run petroleum Authority of Thailand in August last year.

Unocal Thailand is the country's major natural gas producer. In 1996, it produced an average of 800 mmcfd and 28,000 barrels per day of condensate from nine fields on behalf of co-concessionaires Mitsui Oil Exploration and PTTEP.
